text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the incorporation of domestic law obligations under the section 'III. C. Applicable Law (Can the Tribunal Apply Domestic Environmental Law?)'. It discusses the need for the BIT to incorporate domestic law (either through explicit reference, an applicable-law clause including host-state law, or provisions referencing investor compliance) and specifically mentions that under ICSID, Article 42 defaults to host-state law, which is analogous to the custom/incorporation principle sought by the criterion. It cites cases like Burlington/Perenco where domestic environmental law was applied under this mechanism.", "criterion_id": "b21bb6a4-a9dd-4787-83a9-afdb78d12f8e"}
